cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.
Cut the lemon in half and squeeze the juice over the chicken.
Stuff the lemon halves inside the chicken.
Mix the minced garlic with the olive oil and rub it all over the chicken.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Trim the ends off the Brussels sprouts and cut them in half.
Toss the Brussels sprouts with the olive oil, kosher salt, and black pepper.
Roast the Brussels sprouts for 25-30 minutes or until they are tender and caramelized.

ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and kosher salt.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.

description: Ina Garten, also known as the Barefoot Contessa, is a popular American chef, cookbook author, and television host. She is best known for her cooking show, 'Barefoot Contessa,' and her emphasis on using fresh, high-quality ingredients in her recipes. Garten has authored several successful cookbooks, including 'The Barefoot Contessa Cookbook' and 'Barefoot Contessa Family Style,' and has won multiple Emmy Awards for her cooking show

ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Season the beef with salt and pepper.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Sear the beef on all sides until golden brown.
Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over high heat.
Form the beef into 4 patties and season with salt and pepper.
Grill the burgers for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or until cooked to your liking.
Top each burger with a slice of cheese and allow to melt.

ingredients: 1 pound beef sirloin, sliced into thin strips
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
cookingMethod: Season the beef with salt and pepper.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Add the beef and cook until browned, about 3-4 minutes
Remove from the skillet and set aside.
Reduce the heat to medium and add the butter to the skillet.

description: Gordon Ramsay is a British chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is known for his fiery personality and high standards in the kitchen, as well as his popular cooking shows, including 'Hell's Kitchen' and 'MasterChef.' Ramsay has numerous successful restaurants around the world and has also authored several cookbooks, including 'Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course' and 'Gordon Ramsay's Home Cooking.'

cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook the macaroni according to the package directions.
In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Whisk in the flour to make a roux.
Gradually whisk in the milk.

ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a mixing bowl, cream together the butter and 1/2 cup of white sugar.
Stir in the flour and kosher salt until the dough comes together.
Press the dough into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until lightly golden.

ingredients: 2 tbsp. unsalted butter, at room temperature
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.
Rub the butter all over the chicken, including under the skin.
Season the chicken with kosher salt and black pepper.
Stuff the lemon, garlic, and thyme into the cavity of the chicken.

description: Martha Stewart is an American businesswoman, author, and television personality. She is best known for her cooking and home decorating shows, as well as her magazine, Martha Stewart Living. Stewart has authored numerous cookbooks, including 'Martha Stewart's Baking Handbook' and 'Martha Stewart's Cooking School,' and has been recognized with several James Beard Awards.

cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 500°F.
Stretch the pizza dough out into a 12-inch circle and place it on a baking sheet or pizza stone.
Spread the tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border around the edge.
Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Tear the basil leaves into small pieces and sprinkle them over the cheese.
In a saucepan, heat the chicken broth to a simmer.
In a large skillet, melt the butter with the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened.
Add the Arborio rice and stir until the rice is coated with the butter and oil.
Pour in the white wine
Preheat the grill to high heat.
Rub the steaks with the olive oil and season with kosher salt and black pepper.
Rub the minced garlic over the steaks.
Strip the leaves from the rosemary sprig and sprinkle them over the steaks.
Grill the steaks for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare or until the desired level of doneness is achieved.

description: Wolfgang Puck is an Austrian-born American chef and restaurateur. He is known for his innovative and creative approach to cooking, blending traditional French techniques with Asian and California-inspired flavors. Puck has several successful restaurants around the world, including Spago in Beverly Hills, and has authored numerous cookbooks, including 'Wolfgang Puck Makes it Easy' and 'Wolfgang Puck's Pizza, Pasta, and More!

cookingMethod: In a large bowl, toss the mixed greens with the olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season the salad with kosher salt and black pepper.
Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese and chopped walnuts over the salad.
Serve immediately.

ingredients: 2 tbsp. chopped fresh herbs (such as thyme, rosemary, and parsley)
cookingMethod: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, whisk together the olive oil, chopped herbs, kosher salt, and black pepper.
Rub the herb mixture all over the chicken breasts.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Serve the chicken with the lemon wedges.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, onion, garlic, kosher salt, and black pepper to the skillet.
Cook the vegetables, stirring occasionally, until they are softened.
Add the diced tomatoes and their juices to the skillet.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer the ratatouille for 15-20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have

description: Alice Waters is an American chef, author, and food activist. She is known for her advocacy of using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients in her cooking, and for her work in promoting sustainable agriculture and farm-to-table practices. Waters is the founder of the famed restaurant Chez Panisse in Berkeley, California, and has authored several cookbooks, including 'The Art of Simple Food' and 'Chez Panisse Vegetables.

ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
cookingMethod: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and kosher salt.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar together until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs and vanilla extract to the butter mixture and beat until well combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Stir in the baking ingredients, coffee grounds, and oats.

ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cubed and chilled
cookingMethod: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, kosher salt, and granulated sugar.
Cut the chilled butter into small cubes and add them to the flour mixture.
Using a pastry blender or your fingers, cut the butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Gradually add the ice water to the flour mixture and stir until the dough comes together.
Flatten the dough into a disk and wrap it in plastic wrap.
Preheat the oven to 300°F and spread the cornflakes cereal on a baking sheet.
Toast the cereal in the oven for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown.
In a large bowl, whisk together the whole milk, granulated sugar, toasted cornflakes cereal, and kosher salt.
Cover the bowl and refrigerate the mixture for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium saucepan and discard the cereal.

description: Christina Tosi is an American pastry chef and founder of the dessert and bakery chain, Milk Bar. She is known for her inventive and playful approach to desserts, often incorporating unexpected flavors and textures into her creations. Tosi has authored several cookbooks, including 'Milk Bar Life' and 'Milk Bar: Kids Only,' and has been recognized with several James Beard Awards.
